step_text: Wash, chop and prepare all ingredients needed for Aloo Gobi.
Heat oil or ghee in a heavy-bottom pan on medium flame until lightly aromatic.
Add onions, ginger, garlic or green chillies and sauté until soft and golden.
Add potato along with any supporting vegetables or masala bases and cook briefly.
Add tomatoes and spice powders. Cook until the mixture thickens and becomes glossy.
Add a little water to adjust consistency. Cover and simmer on low flame.
Taste, adjust seasoning and cook for another minute for better flavor balance.

Peel and chop onions into very small pieces (pea-size).
Wash and dice tomatoes into small cubes (Ludo dice size).
Peel and cut potatoes into medium cubes (sugar-cube size).
Remove capsicum seeds and chop into small cubes.
Cut cauliflower into small florets (thumb-nail size).
Boil potatoes, cauliflower, peas in pressure cooker for 3 whistles.
In a pan, heat oil and butter; sauté onions till light brown, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes and spices; cook until soft and mushy.
Add boiled veggies and mash with masher; add 0.5–1 cup water, simmer 10 minutes.
Toast pav on tawa with butter until golden; serve with bhaji, chopped onion and lemon.
